repository.corpname: University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Lexington Lodge no. 1 records (dated 1797-2020; 18.2 cubic feet; 15 boxes, 15 items) primarily comprise membership records, meeting minutes, ledgers, annual reports, pamphlets, correspondence, and notes that document the membership and administration of the Masonic Lodge, Lexington Lodge no. 1, in Lexington, Kentucky.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged by subject into 4 series: Membership records, Meeting minutes, Ledgers and reports, and Assorted.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Lexington Lodge no. 1 is a Masonic Lodge located in Lexington, Kentucky. It was founded in 1788 by the Grand Lodge of Virginia as Lexington Lodge no. 25. It became no. 1 in 1800 after the formation of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky. In 1861 during the Civil War, Union Troops occupied the lodge hall and most of the records since the founding of the lodge were destroyed. Following the Civil War, fraternal organizations became imcreasingly popular. During this time, Lexington Lodge no. 1 created programs that increased their membership through the early 1900s. Lexington Lodge no. 1's membership increased steadily, including two large membership spikes after World War I and World War II, until 1962. After 1962, member retention decreased, causing a decrease of overall membership, from 1667 masons to closer to 300. At the turn of the century, engagement increased for Lexington Lodge no. 1's members, and the average age of the active member began to shift younger. Notable early members of Lexington Lodge no. 1 include Henry Clay, Levi Todd, General Thomas Bodley, Gideon Shryock, Joseph Hamilton Daviess, James B. January, John M. McCalla, Benjamin W. Dudley, and Samuel Postlethwaite.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 2018ms011: [identification of item], Lexington Lodge no. 1 records, 1797-2020, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lexington Lodge no. 1 records (dated 1797-2020; 18.2 cubic feet; 15 boxes, 15 items) primarily comprise membership records, meeting minutes, ledgers, annual reports, pamphlets, correspondence, and notes that document the membership and administration of the Masonic Lodge, Lexington Lodge no. 1, in Lexington, Kentucky. The Membership records include completed forms for petitions, dues, and demits. Additionally, the records include membership ledgers. The minutes consist of bound and loose meeting minutes for the lodge from 1860-2007. The majority of records from the late 1700s until 1860 were destroyed during the Civil War when the lodge was occupied by Confederate forces. The records also include financial ledgers and annual reports, letters and pamphlets relating to events and projects, and letters regarding relationships between the Lodge and outside parties.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises ledgers, petitions, and forms that document the membership of Lexington Lodge no. 1. The forms include ones for dues and demits (resignation of membership). Series is organized by format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Comprises meeting minutes that document the Lexington Lodge no. 1's meetings from 1860-2007. The minutes consist of bound volumes and binders. The binders were disassembled and stored in folders, however they are described as one unit. Additionally, the series includes minutes for the Clinton Lodge no. 86 from 1822-1839. Series arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Clinton Lodge no. 86 demits and minutes
Clinton Lodge no. 86 demit forms and minutes
Loose meeting minutes and notes on Lexington Lodge no. 1 projects

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Minutes for 1932 not included in the records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily comprises ledger books and annual reports documenting the fiscal records of the Lexington Lodge no. 1 from 1822-2006. Series is organized chronologically.
Series has been digitized. Some items have been redacted or excluded because of the presence of personally identifiable information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily comprises flyers, promotional material, accounting records, and memoranda regarding events held by the Lexington Lodge no. 1, along with their history and organization.

unittitle.title: A Summarizing History of Lexington Lodge No. I: 1788-2018
The Lexington Experience: The Path of a Masonic Lodge to Define Who They Were and Why They Were The Way They Were
